page.title: 18CUSTOMS,LORE AND LANGUAGE.
page.content: The name{Cowfold}originates from the time when cattle were herded together at night for safety in the locality. The village has a motto - "Non nobis sed communitati" which means "Not for ourselves,but for the community." It was a tradition in Cowfold on May Day for children to make garlands and go round chanting....'The First of May is Garland Day so please remember the garland.We don't come here but once a year,so please remember the garland.'They would then be given a few pennies.At Christmas in the past,not only were carols sung,but quaint verses like this one.... "Today good man you are alive and well. And worth many a thousand pound.But tomorrow you may be dead,and your corpse lie underground."
